bugs.title: CVE-2016-6342 elog: posting entry as arbitrary username by improper authentication

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-6342 elog: posting entry as arbitrary username by improper authentication

long_desc.thetext: It has been reported that one can post from any username entry on the logbook, with a post request and guest readable logbook, using elog 3.1.1.

Created elog tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1371330]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1371331]
elog-3.1.1-7.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
elog-3.1.1-7.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
elog-3.1.1-7.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
elog-3.1.1-7.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

long_desc.thetext: It has been reported that one can post from any username entry on the logbook, with a post request and guest readable logbook, using elog 3.1.1.

Created elog tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1371330]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1371331]
elog-3.1.1-7.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions

against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====
